result.execSummary:
The defendant Vladimir Bystrov was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vladimir Bystrov in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton w/interpreter Lana L.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states case and appearances and recommendations.  Atty Middleton agrees and NC plea entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC - as amended to 948.09 Sex Intercourse w/a Child Misd.
4 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
3 days credit for time served 
$443.00 costs (already paid from cash bond and balance refunded to DE in Court)
Passport returned to DE in Court
DNA sample collected upon arrest

Defendant Vladimir Bystrov in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton and w/interpreter .  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton notes offer is on the table but he needs more time to try and resolve matter.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
15R 013016  - No contact w/ZMD or Flamingo Motel; not to leave State of WI; surrender passport
Passport Received...returned to DE at sentencing on 8/21/2015.

Pre-trial conference at 06-26-2015 09:45 am.
Return date at 07-07-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Vladimir Bystrov in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Vladimir Bystrov in custody.  Lana Levy appears as interpreter.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.   Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $1000.00 cash bond with conditions.  Attorney Middleton objects to surrender of the VISA.  Defendant is here under valid Visa.  Address confirmed.  Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived. $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with Z.M.D. or the Flamingo Motel.  May not leave the State of WI without permission of court.  Surrender passport during time of bond conditions to Clerk of Court.

Submit to Booking and DNA sample.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
